title: Fausto Budicin
text:
Fausto Budicin (born 1 May 1981) is a Croatian professional <a href="Association%20football">football</a> <a href="manager%20%28association%20football%29">manager</a> and former <a href="Football%20player">player</a> who is the most recently manager of <a href="Croatian%20First%20Football%20League">Croatian First Football League</a> club <a href="NK%20Istra%201961">Istra 1961</a>.
Managerial career.
On 27 March 2019, Budicin was appointed new manager at <a href="Croatian%20Third%20Football%20League">Croatian Third Football League</a> club <a href="HNK%20Orijent%201919">Orijent 1919</a>. His first success at Orijent bench came at the end of the season; Orijent gained promotion to the second-tier <a href="Croatian%20Second%20Football%20League">Druga HNL</a> finishing third in the 2018–19 Treća HNL West season.
In the club's inaugural <a href="2019%E2%80%9320%20Croatian%20Second%20Football%20League">second league season</a>, Budicin led the squad to finishing in third at the league table in March 2020, when the championship was postponed due to the <a href="COVID-19%20pandemic%20in%20Croatia">COVID-19 pandemic in Croatia</a>. <a href="NK%20Croatia%20Zmijavci">NK Croatia Zmijavci</a>, that finished in second in the league championship, did not ask for a license to play in the <a href="2020%E2%80%9321%20Croatian%20First%20Football%20League">First League</a>, so Orijent took their place in the <a href="2019%E2%80%9320%20Croatian%20First%20Football%20League%23Relegation%20play-offs">relegation play-offs</a> for a higher tier, in which <a href="NK%20Istra%201961">Istra 1961</a> was more successful.
After Orijent failed to gain promotion to the first tier, Budicin was named head coach of Istra 1961 on 26 August 2020, succeeding <a href="Ivan%20Prelec">Ivan Prelec</a>, whose contract expired and was not renewed. However he has been sacked on 11 February 2021.
Honours.
Player.
Istra
Olimpija Ljubljana
Rijeka
Individual
Manager.
Orijent 1919
